timeline.message: Fix comment and remove extra ProjectSample.java
Project sample - update basemap style and image
Convex hull list - set viewpoint on mapview

timeline.bodyText:
I think wkid 3857 is WebMercator:
https://developers.arcgis.com/web-map-specification/objects/spatialReference/
So we could use the enum SpatialReferences.getWebMercator():
https://developers.arcgis.com/java/latest/api-reference/reference/com/esri/arcgisruntime/geometry/SpatialReferences.html#getWebMercator()
However, I'm pretty sure web mercator is the default SR (or WGS84??), so might be worth leaving it out of the 'new Point` and seeing if it works?
timeline.author: JonLavi

replies.bodyText:
Didn't work removing it. Have replaced it for getWebMercator().  I also made a couple of other additional changes to this one - setting the ViewPoint on the MapView (which still seems to work correctly) and corrected the basemap style to IMAGERY_STANDARD.
Probably one worth an extra check @Rachael-E
replies.author: jenmerritt

timeline.author: JonLavi
JonLavi
JonLavi

replies.bodyText: I've tidied this up a bit

timeline.message: Geodesic sector and ellipse - viewpoint amends

timeline.bodyText:
this is a different scale value than was used in a previous PR https://github.com/Esri/arcgis-runtime-samples-java/pull/599/files#diff-8f2b646da59e98410b35da25b663995af9c16ab65fb85d1d6bea55aeff5de1df
We should try and be consistent with the values that we are swapping: the other values have been consistent between PRs for now :)
if you haven't already seen it, you can refer to this to get an idea of what the exact replacement values would be, but rounding it down as you have been doing should be fine for samples. https://services.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/World_Street_Map/MapServer
where e.g. an old Level of Detail 12 would now be a new scale of 144447.638572
timeline.author: Rachael-E

replies.bodyText: For reference, I've picked up on this point across the changes samples and will correct the scale vs level of detail as per the above link (but rounded)
replies.author: jenmerritt
